items.title: US new H-1B visa fee will not apply to existing holders, Axios reports
items.summary: (Reuters) -A new $100,000 annual fee for H-1B visas in the United States goes into effect Sunday, but it will not be applied to existing holders of valid visas re-entering the country, Axios reported on Saturday. Read full story

items.title: A White House official says the $100K H-1B fee will not apply to renewals or existing holders of valid visas re-entering the US, only new applicants (Ben Berkowitz/Axios)
items.summary:
Ben Berkowitz / Axios:
A White House official says the $100K H-1B fee will not apply to renewals or existing holders of valid visas re-entering the US, only new applicants  —  A new $100,000 fee for H-1B visas goes into effect Sunday, but it will not be applied to existing holders of valid visas re-entering the country, a White House official tells Axios.

items.title: Trump announces skilled worker visas will now cost $100,000
items.summary: All the fawning by tech CEOs wasn’t enough to convince Donald Trump to back off his crusade against immigrants. items.title: Chinese communities donate supplies to conflict victims in Ghana's Savannah

Apple has officially unveiled the iPhone 17 lineup, and if you’re planning a preorder, you’ll want a case ready to protect it from day one. dbrand, as usual, is ahead of the curve – its new collection for the iPhone 17 actually went live days before Apple’s announcement. The lineup includes the updated Ghost 2.0 case, which dbrand guarantees won’t turn yellow over time like many other clear cases do. There’s also the fan-favorite Grip case for folks looking to get a customizable model with ultra-grippy sides. To round things out, dbrand is also offering its Prism Screen Protectors that fit right in with its cases. Hit the jump for a closer look and more details.
